title: 108_s1379
content: The Act is titled the "American Veterans Disabled for Life Commemorative Coin Act". It includes findings related to disabled veterans. Congress acknowledges the service and sacrifices of the Armed Forces, including those who have served in various conflicts. It emphasizes the importance of honoring both living disabled veterans and those who have made the ultimate sacrifice. Additionally, it mentions the authorization of the American Veterans Disabled for Life Memorial in 2000. The United States should honor living disabled veterans by minting a commemorative silver dollar coin, with proceeds going towards the construction of the American Veterans Disabled for Life Memorial. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint $1 silver coins in honor of disabled American veterans, with specific weight, diameter, and composition. These coins will be legal tender and considered numismatic items. The design of the coins will be determined under this Act. The design of the $1 silver coins minted under this Act will be emblematic of the American Veterans Disabled for Life Memorial. The coins will feature inscriptions of the coin's value, the year "2006", and words like "Liberty", "In God We Trust", "United States of America", and "E Pluribus Unum". The design will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with the Disabled Veterans' LIFE Memorial Foundation and the Commission of Fine Arts. The design of the $1 silver coins minted under this Act will be emblematic of the American Veterans Disabled for Life Memorial. The design will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with the Disabled Veterans' LIFE Memorial Foundation, the Commission of Fine Arts, and reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at a single designated facility. The Secretary is authorized to issue coins only during the calendar year starting on January 1, 2006. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. The coins issued under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value of the coins, a $10 surcharge per coin, and the cost of designing and issuing the coins. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted with a reasonable discount on sale prices. SEC. 7. DISTRIBUTION OF SURCHARGES. Surcharges from coin sales go to the Disabled Veterans' LIFE Memorial Foundation for the American Veterans' Disabled for Life Memorial. The Comptroller General can audit the Foundation's expenditures. SEC. 8. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. SEC. 8. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. The Secretary must ensure minting coins won't cost the government. Coins can only be issued if payment is received, security is provided, or a guarantee of payment from a qualified institution is given.
